instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: Retina Screen & eDP pinout for years 2013 / 2014 2015
threads.message:
Hi.

I need a few screens for some Pro Retina machines. 2013 2014 and 2015 13" and a  2015 15"
 
Looking at the schematics there are differences in pin designators like eDP pin 3 / 4 on one board may be labeled as backlight I2C but on another board may be labeled as LED return.

My question is, are these 13" Pro Retina screens interchangeable?

threads.title: Retina Screen & eDP pinout for years 2013 / 2014 2015
threads.message:
no they are not

for 13":
2012 and early 2013 (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>) are interchangeable
late 2013 and 2014 (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>) are interchangeable
none of them can be used in the 2015

for 15"
2012 - 2014 LCD-panel are interchangeable - for complete display only 2012/early2013 and late2013/2014 are interchangeable as webcam connector is different
2015 different

but beware of EDID issues when switching LCD panels....

threads.title: Retina Screen & eDP pinout for years 2013 / 2014 2015
threads.message:
No.

For <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, you have 2012-2014(LP154WT1-SJsomething), then 2015-2016 which is some samsung model I don't have off the top of my head. 

For <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, you have LP133WQ1-SJA1

For <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2013-2014 you have LP133WQ1-SJEV

For <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015-2016 you have some samsung model I do not know off the top of my head.

NONE OF THIS IS INTERCHANGEABLE!

Also note missing anti-glare coating and EDID code issues on any pre-2015 screen you get since they were probably kicked off a truck in wherever-the-fuckistan-this-stuff-is-made... sad reality of how we have to get parts for anything.

threads.title: Retina Screen & eDP pinout for years 2013 / 2014 2015
threads.message:
Wow, good info!
I'll get complete assemblies. I want to change a retina LCD about as much as I want to poke my own eyeballs with searing hot needles
